actions.text: Motion by Senator Reid to reconsider the vote by which amendment SA 715 (Record Vote No. 97) was not agreed to entered in Senate.
Amendment SA 715, under the order of 4/16/13, not having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 54 - 46. Record Vote Number: 97.

Amendment SA 715 proposed by Senator Manchin. (consideration: CR S2584) To protect Second Amendment rights, ensure that all individuals who should be prohibited from buying a firearm are listed in the National Instant Criminal Background Check System, and provide a responsible and consistent background check process.

Roll call votes on amendments in Senate: Amendment SA 715, under the order of 4/16/13, not having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 54 - 46. Record Vote Number: 97.

Senate amendment not agreed to: Amendment SA 715, under the order of 4/16/13, not having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 54 - 46. Record Vote Number: 97.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 715 proposed by Senator Manchin.

purpose: To protect Second Amendment rights, ensure that all individuals who should be prohibited from buying a firearm are listed in the National Instant Criminal Background Check System, and provide a responsible and consistent background check process.
